title: 112_hr6021
content: The Act titled "Rehab and Ahmed Amer Foster Care Improvement Act of 2012" requires states to follow specific procedures when placing a child removed from parental custody. The "Rehab and Ahmed Amer Foster Care Improvement Act of 2012" mandates that within 30 days of a child's removal from parental custody, the state must diligently notify all adult grandparents and relatives about the situation and their legal options. The "Rehab and Ahmed Amer Foster Care Improvement Act of 2012" requires timely notification to adult grandparents and relatives about a child's removal from parental custody, outlining their rights and options for care and placement, including foster family home requirements and available support services. If applicable, it also explains the process for kinship guardianship assistance payments for relative guardians. The State must notify parents, relatives, guardians, and attorneys within 90 days of a placement decision for a child. The State is also required to establish procedures for this notification process. The State must establish procedures for notifying individuals involved in a placement decision for a child, including allowing requests for documentation of reasons for the decision and court review within specific timeframes. The amendment made by subsection (a) will take effect on the 1st day of the 1st fiscal year after the enactment of the Act, applying to payments under part E of title IV of the Social Security Act for calendar quarters after that date. If State legislation is needed for State plans to meet the new requirements, they will not be considered non-compliant until the 1st day of the 1st calendar. The Act requires additional requirements to be met before the 1st day of the 1st calendar quarter following the first regular session of the State legislature after enactment. Each year of a 2-year legislative session is considered a separate regular session.
